text.section: An individual may not have any financial interest in any electrical business while employed by the State, a county, or a local government as an electrical inspector.

section.section:
On appointment or employment as an electrical inspector, the individual:
shall place the State license of the individual on inactive status; and
except for the renewal fee, shall meet the inactive status requirements of § 6-311 of this subtitle.
The State Board may issue an electrical inspector identification card to an electrical inspector who has placed the State license on inactive status.
The State Board may not charge a fee to issue the identification card.

text.section:
The State Board may change the status of an electrical inspector to individual inactive status, if the electrical inspector:
meets the inactive status requirements of § 6-311 of this subtitle; and
pays an inactive status fee of $50.

On termination of the appointment or employment of an individual as an electrical inspector, the State Board shall reactivate the State license of the individual who is on inactive status, without examination, if the individual meets the reactivation requirements for a State license under § 6-311(f) of this subtitle, including payment of the reactivation fee.
